Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. With popularity apparent, studios wanted in on this trend.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen and ancient race: The Modang'Wera.
The desert itself can only be considered as "other worldly." While the movie itself originated from South Africa there is something other worldly about some deserts sand storms and landscapes.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds me of your childhood and some incredible work by Linda Hunt who plays Aunt Clara aka Frau Troffken. Brother Grimm’s German folklore tale “The foresters” is still very interesting.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie; is acted like a Schwarzenegger vehicle of old and actually succeeded wildly with its appeal of cheese,
